constructor:ResourceFactory source

Constructor function for creating a resource service. The resource service is used to make calls to the REST-API via the "method" functions. These are the default method functions:

{
    // Undo all changes on the instance using the cache or by reloading the data from the server
    'restore': {method:'GET', isArray:false},
    // Get a single instance from the API
    'get': {method:'GET', isArray:false},
    // Get a single instance from the API bypassing the cache
    'getNoCache': {method:'GET', isArray:false},
    // Get a list of instances from the API
    'query': {method:'GET', isArray:true},
    // Get a list of instances from the API bypassing the cache
    'queryNoCache': {method:'GET', isArray:true},
    // Save a new instance
    'save': {method:'POST', isArray:false},
    // Update an existing instance
    'update': {method:'PATCH', isArray:false},
    // Delete an instance
    'remove': {method:'DELETE', isArray:false},
}

You can extend or override these methods by using the options.extraMethods option.

Each of these methods is available as "static" version on the returned resource class, or as instance method on a resource instance. The instance methods have a "$" prefix. Each of these methods, static and instance versions, exists with a "Bg" postfix to make the call in the "background". This means you do not see a loading bar if you are using angular-loading-bar ({@link http://chieffancypants.github.io/angular-loading-bar/}).

Dependencies:
NameTypeDescription
name

Name of the resource service
url

URL to the resource
options

Options for the resource
options.stripTrailingSlashes

Strip trailing slashes from request URLs. Defaults to false.
options.ignoreLoadingBar

Ignore the resource for automatic loading bars. Defaults to false.
options.generatePhantomIds

Generate IDs for phantom records created via the new method. Defaults to true.
options.phantomIdGenerator

Phantom ID generator instance used for generating phantom IDs. Defaults to {@link ResourcePhantomIdNegativeInt}.
options.dependent

List of resource services to clean the cache for on modifying requests.
options.extraMethods

Extra request methods to put on the resource service.
options.extraFunctions

Extra functions to put on the resource service instance.
options.pkAttr

Attribute name where to find the ID of objects. Defaults to "pk".
options.urlAttr

Attribute name where to find the URL of objects. Defaults to "url".
options.queryDataAttr

Attribute name where to find the data on the query call (resource list calls). Defaults to null.
options.queryTotalAttr

Attribute name where to find the total amount of data on the query call (resource list calls). Defaults to null.
options.cacheClass

Resource cache class constructor function to use (see {@link ResourceCache}). Defaults to {@link ResourceCacheService}.
options.toInternal

Function to post-process data coming from response. Gets obj, headersGetter and status and should return the processed obj.
options.fromInternal

Function to post-process data that is going to be sent. Gets obj and headersGetter and should return the processed obj.
Example
// Getting and updating an resource instance
 var ex = ExampleResourceService.get({pk: 123});
 ex.$promise.then(function() {
     ex.test = 456;
     ex.$update();
 });
// Saving a new resource instance
 var ex = ExampleResourceService.new({test: 789});
 ex.$save();
// Saving or updating a resource instance
 var ex = get_a_new_or_existing_instance_from_somewhere();
 ex.test = 123;
 ex.$persist();

Methods

resource.createStore

Creates a new store for the resource

Returns:

resource.filter

Queries the resource with the configured filters.

Returns:

resource.filterInstancesByAttr

Gets a list of instances from the given instances where the given attribute name matches the given attribute value.

resource.filterNoCache

Queries the resource with the configured filters without using the cache.

Returns:

resource.getCache

Gets the cache instance.

Returns:

resource.getDataAttr

Gets the data attribute name

Returns:

resource.getInstanceByAttr

Gets the first instance from the given instances where the given attribute name matches the given attribute value.

Returns:

resource.getInstanceByPk

Gets the first instance from the given instances where the PK attribute has the given value.

Returns:

resource.getPkAttr

Gets the PK attribute name

Returns:

resource.getQueryFilters

Returns an object holding the filter data for query request

Returns:

resource.getResourceName

Gets the name of the resource.

Returns:

resource.isPhantom

Checks if the given instance is a phantom instance (instance not persisted to the REST API yet)

Returns:

resource.new

Creates a new instance for the resource

Returns:

resource.persist

Saves the given resource instance to the REST API. Uses the $save method if instance is phantom, else the $update method.

Returns:

resource.setDefaultQueryFilters

Sets the given filter options if the aren't already set on the filter object

Returns:

resource.setQueryFilters

Sets the object holding the filter data for query request

Returns:
